title: Seriously shall we have a dedicated eng thread here?

replies.msg: For consolidating and translating important articles into various languages for foreign consumption using more formal and readable English? What do you guys think?

The membership requirements for lihkg (and thus posting rights) would exclude quite a bunch of Hong Kongers who are proficient in English enough to contribute translation work and yet do not have a Hong Kong ISP email address.

There is a telegram group pretty much for this purpose, but I don't think I could generate an invite link as a member.
what about a reddit thread link

quote.msg:
The membership requirements for lihkg (and thus posting rights) would exclude quite a bunch of Hong Kongers who are proficient in English enough to contribute translation work and yet do not have a Hong Kong ISP email address.

There is a telegram group pretty much for this purpose, but I don't think I could generate an invite link as a member.

replies.msg:
Thanks for your prompt reply.
My initial idea is the consolidated thread can get the translated articles together and it will be more helpful if the LIHKG could flag it up for public consumption. Who take the translation job is not a big issue here. The point is a more efficient or centralised way of distributing the multilingual messages out.

quote.msg: what about a reddit thread link

replies.msg:
Yes. Reddit of course is a way and I know many people are working on there. But I am guessing if a LIHKG thread can also contribute as it is thought to be geographically more representative?
The article from FT enlightens me of this idea. I hope you guys can give more comments to see if we should go for it or not.
Meanwhile a bunch of members prefer LIHKG to remain a low key community..
Support
Push
Good idea

quote.msg: Meanwhile a bunch of members prefer LIHKG to remain a low key community..

replies.msg: I do not understand. Any platform will be subject to strong attacks once started.
I go to school by bus

I will monitor this post for one day or so to see what happens next. If the post is sinking rather quickly I will think most of you are not buying the idea. But if there are more support perhaps we can next start selecting important articles and start translation or directly pasting finished articles here. I don't think English is not only medium but we can make it a start. I understand there is no single leader, following the spirit and tradition of the campaign.

How to keep this on top among threads
Problem
Definitely !

quote.msg:
How to keep this on top among threads
Problem

replies.msg: With a little help from admin and with daily contribution from us I do not think it is a big problem.
We should gather twitter users and retweet important news and message
I will try my best to help you. Feel free to share your comments or place your questions here regarding the movement.
Support English thread

Today, hundreds protesters tried to stop the operation of Tax Revenue Department and Immigration Department. The outcome was not a successful one due to not enough of protesters, and better preparation from the Tax Revenue Department.

Now the protesters set sight on the upcoming protest on 26th. Please join us if you were available.

quote.msg: We should gather twitter users and retweet important news and message

replies.msg: Great idea.

quote.msg: We should gather twitter users and retweet important news and message
Great idea.

replies.msg: It’s important to retweet news from verified sources and also let the world know how our government and police force do to us (with particular hashtag maybe)
just a 中文回覆 passing through

I have always advocated for English corner in lihkg, but for different reasons than OP suggested.

Establishment of such English corner could raise English awareness amoungst HK people whose English ability has fallen significantly in recent decade.

But most importantly, English act as an effective gate keeping to keep the low quality comment out, raising the discussion quality of the forum.

quote.msg:
I have always advocated for English corner in lihkg, but for different reasons than OP suggested.

Establishment of such English corner could raise English awareness amoungst HK people whose English ability has fallen significantly in recent decade.

But most importantly, English act as an effective gate keeping to keep the low quality comment out, raising the discussion quality of the forum.

replies.msg: Thanks for your support notwithstanding such differences you raised.
White people don't use lihkg. Don't bother.
BBC is doing the exact same thing.
Push

quote.msg: White people don't use lihkg. Don't bother.

replies.msg:
Foreign media is pretty interested to know more about LIHKG as it has become a powerful uniting platform in this movement.
Also, don’t forget about the huge expat population HK has - there are many international school kids who care for HK but feel distant from the local community, simply because of language barrier. The Reddit HK sub somehow has an outsider lens that Hongkongers who know only English cannot exactly identify with.
Having an english thread would help - these people can ease into the chinese discussions and learn more canto/slangs.

The Reddit HK sub somehow has an outsider lens that Hongkongers who know only English cannot exactly identify with.
Having an english thread would help - these people can ease into the chinese discussions and learn more canto/slangs.

replies.msg: I think timeliness is also a key factor that should be considered as well. If we can react swiftly enough and create some quality content we may be able to create an additional boost to the impact .
